brewery.brewery_description:
We’re a proud Cornish brewery, founded in 1997. Over the course of nearly 25 years Skinner’s has become one of Cornwall’s most recognisable and iconic brands, with Betty Stogs, Porthleven and Lushington’s flying the flag for great Cornish beer.

We’ve charted our own course, danced to a different tune, and been the life and soul of the party for over two decades – always striving to give back to the community we know and love.

The brewery went into administration in October 2022.

beer.beer_description: Bracing Pale Ale. A strong malty flavour is balanced by the floral hops, with a peppering of liquorice and lemon and pine touches. This is a proper session beer, good with fish, as you might expect, as well as cured meats and a properly hot vindaloo.

items.comment: I wasn’t a fan of trawler

items.badge_description: While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 120 check-ins at venue that is verified. Try 5 more for Level 25!

beer.beer_description:
With whole-flower Celeia, Northdown and Aurora hops alongside malted barley and wheat, this is a Cornish twist on a classic smooth-drinking ale. The light malty aroma leads to a floral, even cedar taste, and a sharp tang of bitter grapefruit leaves a lasting impression; just like Betty herself…

The full-bodied, fun-loving character of Betty Stogs marched straight out of Cornish folklore to take her throne as the Queen of Cornish ales.

A quirky character yes, from Cornish folklore, Betty Stogs was reputedly full-bodied, golden-hearted and just a little fruity. So, you can see why we chose to name our award-winning, smooth-drinking amber ale after her.

items.checkin_comment: Christmas beer from Jess. Very nice. Quite light but yum

beer.beer_description:
Made with Cornish water, whole-flower Northdown, Citra and Mount Hood hops, this straw-coloured pale ale is a class act! Citrus-soaked and finishing with a shimmer of passionfruit, this zesty, hoppy combo is as fresh as Cornish sea spray on a hot day.

The buzzing little town of Porthleven on the south coast of Cornwall is home to an iconic surf break as well as a vibrant food scene.

Skinner’s have always been a surf-loving band of brewers, when this wave works on the south coast of Cornwall, you will see Steve’s son Ben Skinner and Ben’s son Lukas surfing here, Ben named his youngest son ‘Leven’ after one of his favourite surf spots. So this beer was named in honour of Cornwall’s iconic surfing break, this fine, strong pale ale is as refreshing as the fine ocean spray hitting your face as you ride the perfect wave. Only you get to enjoy it without even getting your feet wet.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 55 check-ins with a photo.

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 25 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 6!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 20 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 5.

The buzzing little town of Porthleven on the south coast of Cornwall is home to an iconic surf break as well as a vibrant food scene.

Skinner’s have always been a surf-loving band of brewers, when this wave works on the south coast of Cornwall, you will see Steve’s son Ben Skinner and Ben’s son Lukas surfing here, Ben named his youngest son ‘Leven’ after one of his favourite surf spots. So this beer was named in honour of Cornwall’s iconic surfing break, this fine, strong pale ale is as refreshing as the fine ocean spray hitting your face as you ride the perfect wave. items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 330 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 67!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 50 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 11.

items.checkin_comment: Was like absolute vinegar but the barman changed it for me

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 395 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.

beer.beer_description: Our world-famous strong Christmas ale smooth with superb hoppy and aromatic characteristics. Definitely one for the discerning ale drinker.

Bracing Pale Ale. A strong malty flavour is balanced by the floral hops, with a peppering of liquorice and lemon and pine touches. This is a proper session beer, good with fish, as you might expect, as well as cured meats and a properly hot vindaloo.
Golden Honey Beer

items.badge_description: Sometimes you need a break from all the hops, fruits, and spices. What better way than with a crisp, smooth Blonde Ale or Golden Ale? Basic but delicious. That's 35 different beers with the style of Blonde Ale or Golden Ale. Try 5 more for Level 8!

beer.beer_description:
Starting with Cornish water, our brewers add whole-flower Citra, Belma and Willamette hops to create this fresh-as-a-daisy, hop-laden IPA. Bitter-sweet notes of lime, mango and lychee, a slight creaminess and a hint of juicy strawberry delivers sunshine-ready levels of refreshment.

Inspired by those endless summer moments on the beach with friends – which is when the Cornish crowd reach into the cool box for the Lushies.

It’s said, somewhere way down south, in a cove between St Ives and Padstow, you’ll find a perfect beach where you can spend hazy, lazy summer days lying in the warm sun with good friends and not a care in the world. And, as the sun begins to sink into the sea, the only thing that could make life any better would be a glass of cool, hop-laden pale ale. This is the feeling and the moment that Lushingtons was brewed for.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 250 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 51! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

Whether you’re catching a matinee or at a midnight showing, why not enjoy your favorite brew - where available of course. Let’s face it, the beer is probably less than your ticket! That's a beer at 5 different places categorized as a Movie Theatre or Theatre. Try 5 more places for Level 2!

items.checkin_comment: A very nice Christmas ale. Good that Skinners is back

beer.beer_description: Our world-famous strong Christmas ale smooth with superb hoppy and aromatic characteristics. Definitely one for the discerning ale drinker.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 230 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 47!

beer.beer_description:
With whole-flower Celeia, Northdown and Aurora hops alongside malted barley and wheat, this is a Cornish twist on a classic smooth-drinking ale. The light malty aroma leads to a floral, even cedar taste, and a sharp tang of bitter grapefruit leaves a lasting impression; just like Betty herself…

The full-bodied, fun-loving character of Betty Stogs marched straight out of Cornish folklore to take her throne as the Queen of Cornish ales.

A quirky character yes, from Cornish folklore, Betty Stogs was reputedly full-bodied, golden-hearted and just a little fruity. So, you can see why we chose to name our award-winning, smooth-drinking amber ale after her.

Made with Cornish water, whole-flower Northdown, Citra and Mount Hood hops, this straw-coloured pale ale is a class act! Citrus-soaked and finishing with a shimmer of passionfruit, this zesty, hoppy combo is as fresh as Cornish sea spray on a hot day.

The buzzing little town of Porthleven on the south coast of Cornwall is home to an iconic surf break as well as a vibrant food scene.

Skinner’s have always been a surf-loving band of brewers, when this wave works on the south coast of Cornwall, you will see Steve’s son Ben Skinner and Ben’s son Lukas surfing here, Ben named his youngest son ‘Leven’ after one of his favourite surf spots. So this beer was named in honour of Cornwall’s iconic surfing break, this fine, strong pale ale is as refreshing as the fine ocean spray hitting your face as you ride the perfect wave. Only you get to enjoy it without even getting your feet wet.

Starting with Cornish water, our brewers add whole-flower Citra, Belma and Willamette hops to create this fresh-as-a-daisy, hop-laden IPA. Bitter-sweet notes of lime, mango and lychee, a slight creaminess and a hint of juicy strawberry delivers sunshine-ready levels of refreshment.

Inspired by those endless summer moments on the beach with friends – which is when the Cornish crowd reach into the cool box for the Lushies.

It’s said, somewhere way down south, in a cove between St Ives and Padstow, you’ll find a perfect beach where you can spend hazy, lazy summer days lying in the warm sun with good friends and not a care in the world. And, as the sun begins to sink into the sea, the only thing that could make life any better would be a glass of cool, hop-laden pale ale. This is the feeling and the moment that Lushingtons was brewed for.

Ground-Breaking Golden Ale. The taste of the delicate floral hops trails citrus with a slight pine bitterness and leaves you with a mild biscuit taste. Posh ones, not your average digestive. A perfect pairing for shellfish, Thai dishes and a double cheeseburger with fries.

Buzzin' Honeyed Ale. 

As co-workers go, you can’t get much better than a bee. Striking uniform, very industrious and they love a little dance. Plus it’s thanks to them that we’re able to add honey to our hops and enrich the flavour of our refreshing Amber Ale. May result in a pleasurable buzz and being irresistibly dream to flowers.

Floral beneath a delicate spicy tangerine scent with a touch of toffee, And its bittersweet finish is great for game, sausages or a chocolate fudge sundae.

Collaboration English Pale Ale. By sourcing the best English hops and combining them with the finest Cornish malted barley, we've made a beer that's high in complex aromatics, with floral, cedar and citrus notes, and a long bittersweet finish.

When you have a pint of this deep, dark, smooth-drinking milk stout in front of you, your nose will pick up coffee and chocolate flavours while your tongue will be treated to a bitter-sweetness with a touch of the florals. Try it with oysters, cured meats and the odd chocolate coin.

Bracing Pale Ale. A strong malty flavour is balanced by the floral hops, with a peppering of liquorice and lemon and pine touches. This is a proper session beer, good with fish, as you might expect, as well as cured meats and a properly hot vindaloo.

Sennen is a special edition pale zingy session beer from Skinner's in Cornwall with stunning fruit flavours and aromas. Like it's sister beer Porthleven we have selected the most spectacular hops from around the world from the new season's harvest and using only Cornish Pale Malt have created one of the palest, fruitiest, zingy and exciting beers you will ever taste.
A superb refreshing golden ale, brewed during the 6 Nations every February and March.
A lovely hoppy golden ale, fused with Cornish honey, gives this session beer a superb round finish with a hint of ginger. First brewed for red headed pancake tossers!

Our brewers notes: Combining the vibrant New World hops Citra, Motueka, Belma and Pacifica to give you an explosion of flavour with bright notes of orange. It’s a stand-out session beer that packs a perfectly timed delivery of juicy citrus and mellow tropical fruit balanced here with sweet pale malt and lime-burst levels of refreshment with a light toasty spice base.

Chapel Rock stands proud in the middle of Perranporth Beach, adorned with the Cornish flag.

This surf-loving band of brewers is never far from the Cornish coast, but on those first warm days of spring when the days lengthen we simply can’t tear ourselves away.

On days like this, in the shadow of Chapel Rock on Perranporth Beach, you’ll find various members of the Skinner’s family and crew enjoying their home break or simply a sessionable beer or two.
Our world-famous strong Christmas ale smooth with superb hoppy and aromatic characteristics. Definitely one for the discerning ale drinker.
Magical Pale Session Ale.

Kickov is brewed in Cornwall with Cornish malts and the finest European hops. This refreshing and summery golden ale is truly a pint of two halves with delicate crisp bite of the whole-flower hops off set with mild caramel flavours of the pale malt.
Brewed with wet hops freshly harvested. A pale coloured bitter with an understated green tinge. Very well balanced yet bursting with flavour... you can almost taste the hop fields

Dry-hopped during fermentation, Towans packs a powerful burst of fruity flavours and aromas that are deepened by the dense, frothy head. The malt that produces the distinctive head also imparts a wheat flavour that gradually cedes to a clean, citrus finish with a sharp, refreshing edge. A great session lager, and a perfect partner for spicy food and gourmet burgers. This unique lager honours Cornwall’s coastal “towans”, or sand dunes. The Atlantic winds and tides that shaped these rugged hills also inspired our brewers as they crafted Towans’ powerful taste, refreshing aromas and foamy white head. Like Cornwall and its people, it is born of the sea and the maritime climate, and evokes the tastes, sights and mood of the region.

The second release in our limited edition Aleblazer series, Hazy Mango pairs the soft biscuit flavours of the Cornish malts perfectly with the smooth tropical flavours of Citra, Azacca and Idaho-7. Perfect for a warm summer’s evening!
Aged with cacao nibs
Limited edition Aleblazer series. All Slovenian hops: Wolf, Eagle, Dragon, Eureka. Made with Cornish water, whole-flower hops, wheat, Cornish malted barley and Skinner’s unique yeast.

"A stunning pale ale brewed with 7 of the most sought after varieties of whole flower hops from around the globe. Initial flavours of spicy orange, gooseberry and citrus fruits are overcome by summer berries and a light cedar finish. Definately a beer that love their HOPS!

Very limited cask availability in February and  October."

At 5% ABV, Hellup! is a refreshing Cornish lager with real substance. A masterful mash-up of styles, clean and crisp lager meets subtle hops and sweet malts in this classic German helles style.
An elusive style for us brewers to emulate and craft beer lovers to seek out, German-style helles is a malt-accented lager. We’ve combined Magnum and Motueka hops with German Pilsner and Vienna malts to create a smooth and soft golden lager. Expect subtle breadiness and bitter notes, refreshingly interlaced with pine, herbs and citrus.

Originally released in 2012, for the Golden Jubilee, the 4.1% ABV pale ale has been re-brewed for the Platinum event. “Royal Wave is a playful homage to Her Majesty from us lovable rogues here in the far west,” says the brewer.

Containing new world hops with attitude such as Belma, Rakau, Nelson Sauvin & Idaho-7. This is a modern style red ale brewed with pale Cornish and speciality European malts. Red in colour, bursting with juicy flavours of tropical fruit, strawberries, melon with a citrus note. Toasted Red Velvet Ale is #3 of 4 of our unique, limited edition beers. These new releases have been created in line with the Skinners spirit of experimentation; finding interesting ingredients and making good beer that tastes great.
